intro: Borreria assurgens var. longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled borreria, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This species is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
